docs.abstract: Nextel Communications vice president Richard Cichanowicz testifies that merger between Oracle Corp and PeopleSoft could cost Nextel tens of millions of dollars; says if Oracle completes merger, it will have no reason to upgrade PeopleSoft system that his company uses to manage its financial and human resources operations; Emerson Electric senior executive Charles Peters testifies that merger will be positive because it will allow combined company to compete better with SAP of Germany (M)
docs.snippet: A merger between Oracle and PeopleSoft could cost Nextel Communications tens of millions of dollars, a Nextel executive told a federal court on Monday.    Richard Cichanowicz, a Nextel vice president, said that if Oracle completed the merger, it w...
docs.lead_paragraph: A merger between Oracle and PeopleSoft could cost Nextel Communications tens of millions of dollars, a Nextel executive told a federal court on Monday. Richard Cichanowicz, a Nextel vice president, said that if Oracle completed the merger, it would have no motivation to upgrade the PeopleSoft system that his company uses to manage its financial and human resources operations.

headline.main: Customer of PeopleSoft Testifies Against Merger

docs.abstract: Engineers are working to build cars that recognize difficult driving situations and gauge when driver is overwhelmed by distractions, electronic and otherwise; such cars would delay all but most urgent alerts, sending phone calls to voice mail and freeing driver to focus on road or most important task.
docs.snippet: Engineers are working to build cars that recognize when a driver is in distress. Then the car would react, delaying all but the most urgent alerts, sending phone calls to voice mail and freeing the driver to focus on the task....
docs.lead_paragraph: Engineers are working to build cars that recognize when a driver is in distress. Then the car would react, delaying all but the most urgent alerts, sending phone calls to voice mail and freeing the driver to focus on the task.

headline.seo: As Workload Overwhelms, Cars Are Set to Intervene

docs.abstract: Three Mazda 6 sedans competing in Rolex 24 endurance race at Daytona International Speedway will be equipped with diesel engines, technology that has never before competed at speedway; Mazda aims to publicize 2.2-liter turbodiesel engine, one element of company’s Skyactiv strategy to improve efficiency, by using racing to prove engine's mettle.
docs.snippet: Three Mazda 6s that competed in the Rolex 24 endurance race last week used diesel engines, a technology the company says has never competed at Daytona....

headline.print_headline: For Mazda, It’s Diesels at Daytona

headline.seo: For Mazda, It’s Diesels at Daytona

docs.abstract: Unusual-looking DeltaWing racecar may be most innovative and most polarizing design to appear in years; by minimizing aerodynamic drag and cutting weight, car is roughly as fast as those that have twice as much horsepower.
